newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australis confident of bond consents.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australis confident of bond consents.

text.p: Pay television operator Australis Media Ltd said on Friday it was very confident of receiving the consents from U.S. bondholders needed to go ahead with a further US$225 million bond issue, which is crucial to the company's survival.
"We are very confident that we'll get the consent of all bond holders, including Merrill Lynch," an Australis spokesman told Reuters after speaking to Australis Managing Director Neil Gamble.

Earlier on Friday newspapers reported that Merrill Lynch, Australis' largest bond-holder, was concerned that Australis had sold its assets too cheaply under the rescue financing package announced on Tuesday.
"Those stories were exaggerated to say the least," the spokesman said, adding that Australis expected the consents early next week.
"We don't forsee any problem with the funding package," he said.

Packer's Publishing and Broadcasting Ltd, Lenfest Communications Inc of the United States, Ron Brierley's Guinness Peat Group, UIH International Holdings and Television and Radio Services Pty Ltd agreed to inject a further US$105 million into Australis in conjunction with a joint venture agreement with Optus Vision.
Australis needs the approval of the bond holders to proceed with a further issue of US$225 million of bonds.
The US$105 million rescue package came after the bondholders demanded that at least US$100 million was injected before they granted approval.
Australis shares were two cents lower at 24 cents by 10.40 a.m. (0040 GMT) on Friday.
